dataformat.name: asn1
dataformat.title: ASN.1 File
dataformat.description: Encode and decode data structures using Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1).
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,file

usingIterator.description: If the asn1 file has more than one entry, the setting this option to true, allows working with the splitter EIP, to split the data using an iterator in a streaming mode.

dataformat.name: avro
dataformat.title: Avro
dataformat.description: Serialize and deserialize messages using Apache Avro binary data format.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

instanceClassName.description: Class name to use for marshal and unmarshalling

dataformat.name: avroJackson
dataformat.title: Avro Jackson
dataformat.description: Marshal POJOs to Avro and back using Jackson.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

objectMapper.label: advanced
objectMapper.description: Lookup and use the existing ObjectMapper with the given id when using Jackson.

useDefaultObjectMapper.description: Whether to lookup and use default Jackson ObjectMapper from the registry.

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

jsonView.description: When marshalling a POJO to JSON you might want to exclude certain fields from the JSON output. With Jackson you can use JSON views to accomplish this. This option is to refer to the class which has JsonView annotations

include.description: If you want to marshal a pojo to JSON, and the pojo has some fields with null values. And you want to skip these null values, you can set this option to NON_NULL

allowJmsType.label: advanced
allowJmsType.description: Used for JMS users to allow the JMSType header from the JMS spec to specify a FQN classname to use to unmarshal to.

collectionType.label: advanced
collectionType.description: Refers to a custom collection type to lookup in the registry to use. This option should rarely be used, but allows to use different collection types than java.util.Collection based as default.

useList.description: To unmarshal to a List of Map or a List of Pojo.

moduleClassNames.label: advanced
moduleClassNames.description: To use custom Jackson modules com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.Module specified as a String with FQN class names. Multiple classes can be separated by comma.

moduleRefs.label: advanced
moduleRefs.description: To use custom Jackson modules referred from the Camel registry. Multiple modules can be separated by comma.

enableFeatures.description: Set of features to enable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

disableFeatures.description: Set of features to disable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

allowUnmarshallType.description: If enabled then Jackson is allowed to attempt to use the CamelJacksonUnmarshalType header during the unmarshalling. This should only be enabled when desired to be used.

timezone.label: advanced
timezone.description: If set then Jackson will use the Timezone when marshalling/unmarshalling.

autoDiscoverObjectMapper.label: advanced
autoDiscoverObjectMapper.description: If set to true then Jackson will lookup for an objectMapper into the registry

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

schemaResolver.label: advanced
schemaResolver.description: Optional schema resolver used to lookup schemas for the data in transit.

autoDiscoverSchemaResolver.label: advanced
autoDiscoverSchemaResolver.description: When not disabled, the SchemaResolver will be looked up into the registry

dataformat.name: barcode
dataformat.title: Barcode
dataformat.description: Transform strings to various 1D/2D barcode bitmap formats and back.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

imageType.description: Image type of the barcode such as png

dataformat.name: base64
dataformat.title: Base64
dataformat.description: Encode and decode data using Base64.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

lineLength.description: To specific a maximum line length for the encoded data. By default 76 is used.

lineSeparator.label: advanced
lineSeparator.description: The line separators to use. Uses new line characters (CRLF) by default.

urlSafe.label: advanced
urlSafe.description: Instead of emitting '' and '/' we emit '-' and '_' respectively. urlSafe is only applied to encode operations. Decoding seamlessly handles both modes. Is by default false.

dataformat.name: bindyCsv
dataformat.title: Bindy CSV
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal between POJOs and Comma separated values (CSV) format using Camel Bindy
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

type.description: Whether to use Csv, Fixed, or KeyValue.

classType.description: Name of model class to use.

allowEmptyStream.description: Whether to allow empty streams in the unmarshal process. If true, no exception will be thrown when a body without records is provided.

unwrapSingleInstance.label: advanced
unwrapSingleInstance.description: When unmarshalling should a single instance be unwrapped and returned instead of wrapped in a java.util.List.

locale.label: advanced
locale.description: To configure a default locale to use, such as us for united states. To use the JVM platform default locale then use the name default

dataformat.name: bindyFixed
dataformat.title: Bindy Fixed Length
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal between POJOs and fixed field length format using Camel Bindy
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

type.description: Whether to use Csv, Fixed, or KeyValue.

classType.description: Name of model class to use.

allowEmptyStream.description: Whether to allow empty streams in the unmarshal process. If true, no exception will be thrown when a body without records is provided.

unwrapSingleInstance.label: advanced
unwrapSingleInstance.description: When unmarshalling should a single instance be unwrapped and returned instead of wrapped in a java.util.List.

locale.label: advanced
locale.description: To configure a default locale to use, such as us for united states. To use the JVM platform default locale then use the name default

dataformat.name: bindyKvp
dataformat.title: Bindy Key Value Pair
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal between POJOs and key-value pair (KVP) format using Camel Bindy
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

type.description: Whether to use Csv, Fixed, or KeyValue.

classType.description: Name of model class to use.

allowEmptyStream.description: Whether to allow empty streams in the unmarshal process. If true, no exception will be thrown when a body without records is provided.

unwrapSingleInstance.label: advanced
unwrapSingleInstance.description: When unmarshalling should a single instance be unwrapped and returned instead of wrapped in a java.util.List.

locale.label: advanced
locale.description: To configure a default locale to use, such as us for united states. To use the JVM platform default locale then use the name default

dataformat.name: cbor
dataformat.title: CBOR
dataformat.description: Unmarshal a CBOR payload to POJO and back.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,json

objectMapper.label: advanced
objectMapper.description: Lookup and use the existing CBOR ObjectMapper with the given id when using Jackson.

useDefaultObjectMapper.description: Whether to lookup and use default Jackson CBOR ObjectMapper from the registry.

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

collectionType.label: advanced
collectionType.description: Refers to a custom collection type to lookup in the registry to use. This option should rarely be used, but allows to use different collection types than java.util.Collection based as default.

useList.description: To unmarshal to a List of Map or a List of Pojo.

allowUnmarshallType.description: If enabled then Jackson CBOR is allowed to attempt to use the CamelCBORUnmarshalType header during the unmarshalling. This should only be enabled when desired to be used.

prettyPrint.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

allowJmsType.label: advanced
allowJmsType.description: Used for JMS users to allow the JMSType header from the JMS spec to specify a FQN classname to use to unmarshal to.

enableFeatures.description: Set of features to enable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

disableFeatures.description: Set of features to disable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

dataformat.name: crypto
dataformat.title: Crypto (Java Cryptographic Extension)
dataformat.description: Encrypt and decrypt messages using Java Cryptography Extension (JCE).
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,security

algorithm.description: The JCE algorithm name indicating the cryptographic algorithm that will be used.

keyRef.description: Refers to the secret key to lookup from the register to use.

cryptoProvider.label: advanced
cryptoProvider.description: The name of the JCE Security Provider that should be used.

initVectorRef.label: advanced
initVectorRef.description: Refers to a byte array containing the Initialization Vector that will be used to initialize the Cipher.

algorithmParameterRef.label: advanced
algorithmParameterRef.description: A JCE AlgorithmParameterSpec used to initialize the Cipher. Will lookup the type using the given name as a java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec type.

bufferSize.description: The size of the buffer used in the signature process.

macAlgorithm.description: The JCE algorithm name indicating the Message Authentication algorithm.

shouldAppendHMAC.description: Flag indicating that a Message Authentication Code should be calculated and appended to the encrypted data.

inline.label: advanced
inline.description: Flag indicating that the configured IV should be inlined into the encrypted data stream. Is by default false.

dataformat.name: csv
dataformat.title: CSV
dataformat.description: Handle CSV (Comma Separated Values) payloads.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

formatRef.label: advanced
formatRef.description: The reference format to use, it will be updated with the other format options, the default value is CSVFormat.DEFAULT

formatName.label: advanced
formatName.description: The name of the format to use, the default value is CSVFormat.DEFAULT

commentMarkerDisabled.label: advanced
commentMarkerDisabled.description: Disables the comment marker of the reference format.

commentMarker.label: advanced
commentMarker.description: Sets the comment marker of the reference format.

delimiter.description: Sets the delimiter to use. The default value is , (comma)

escapeDisabled.label: advanced
escapeDisabled.description: Use for disabling using escape character

escape.label: advanced
escape.description: Sets the escape character to use

allowMissingColumnNames.description: Whether to allow missing column names.

quote.description: Sets the quote which by default is

recordSeparator.description: Sets the record separator (aka new line) which by default is new line characters (CRLF)

skipHeaderRecord.description: Whether to skip the header record in the output

ignoreHeaderCase.description: Sets whether or not to ignore case when accessing header names.

trim.description: Sets whether or not to trim leading and trailing blanks.

trailingDelimiter.description: Sets whether or not to add a trailing delimiter.

marshallerFactoryRef.label: advanced
marshallerFactoryRef.description: Sets the implementation of the CsvMarshallerFactory interface which is able to customize marshalling/unmarshalling behavior by extending CsvMarshaller or creating it from scratch.

lazyLoad.label: advanced
lazyLoad.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce an iterator that reads the lines on the fly or if all the lines must be read at one.

useMaps.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce maps (HashMap)for the lines values instead of lists. It requires to have header (either defined or collected).

useOrderedMaps.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce ordered maps (LinkedHashMap) for the lines values instead of lists. It requires to have header (either defined or collected).

recordConverterRef.label: advanced
recordConverterRef.description: Refers to a custom CsvRecordConverter to lookup from the registry to use.

captureHeaderRecord.label: advanced
captureHeaderRecord.description: Whether the unmarshalling should capture the header record and store it in the message header

dataformat.name: fastjson
dataformat.title: JSON Fastjson
dataformat.description: Marshal POJOs to JSON and back using Fastjson
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,json

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: fhirJson
dataformat.title: FHIR JSon
dataformat.description: Marshall and unmarshall FHIR objects to/from JSON.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,hl7,json

fhirVersion.description: The version of FHIR to use. Possible values are: DSTU2,DSTU2_HL7ORG,DSTU2_1,DSTU3,R4,R5

fhirContext.label: advanced
fhirContext.description: To use a custom fhir context. Reference to object of type ca.uhn.fhir.context.FhirContext

prettyPrint.description: Sets the pretty print flag, meaning that the parser will encode resources with human-readable spacing and newlines between elements instead of condensing output as much as possible.

parserErrorHandler.label: advanced
parserErrorHandler.description: Registers an error handler which will be invoked when any parse errors are found. Reference to object of type ca.uhn.fhir.parser.IParserErrorHandler

parserOptions.label: advanced
parserOptions.description: Sets the parser options object which will be used to supply default options to newly created parsers. Reference to object of type ca.uhn.fhir.context.ParserOptions.

preferTypes.label: advanced
preferTypes.description: If set (FQN class names), when parsing resources the parser will try to use the given types when possible, in the order that they are provided (from highest to lowest priority). For example, if a custom type which declares to implement the Patient resource is passed in here, and the parser is parsing a Bundle containing a Patient resource, the parser will use the given custom type. Multiple class names can be separated by comma.

forceResourceId.label: advanced
forceResourceId.description: When encoding, force this resource ID to be encoded as the resource ID. Reference to object of type org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IIdType

serverBaseUrl.label: advanced
serverBaseUrl.description: Sets the server's base URL used by this parser. If a value is set, resource references will be turned into relative references if they are provided as absolute URLs but have a base matching the given base.

omitResourceId.label: advanced
omitResourceId.description: If set to true (default is false) the ID of any resources being encoded will not be included in the output. Note that this does not apply to contained resources, only to root resources. In other words, if this is set to true, contained resources will still have local IDs but the outer/containing ID will not have an ID.

encodeElementsAppliesToChildResourcesOnl.displayName: Encode Elements Applies To Child Resources Only
encodeElementsAppliesToChildResourcesOnl.label: advanced
encodeElementsAppliesToChildResourcesOnl.description: If set to true (default is false), the values supplied to setEncodeElements(Set) will not be applied to the root resource (typically a Bundle), but will be applied to any sub-resources contained within it (i.e. search result resources in that bundle)

encodeElements.label: advanced
encodeElements.description: If provided, specifies the elements which should be encoded, to the exclusion of all others. Multiple elements can be separated by comma when using String parameter. Valid values for this field would include: Patient - Encode patient and all its children Patient.name - Encode only the patient's name Patient.name.family - Encode only the patient's family name .text - Encode the text element on any resource (only the very first position may contain a wildcard) .(mandatory) - This is a special case which causes any mandatory fields (min 0) to be encoded

dontEncodeElements.label: advanced
dontEncodeElements.description: If provided, specifies the elements which should NOT be encoded. Multiple elements can be separated by comma when using String parameter. Valid values for this field would include: Patient - Don't encode patient and all its children Patient.name - Don't encode the patient's name Patient.name.family - Don't encode the patient's family name .text - Don't encode the text element on any resource (only the very first position may contain a wildcard) DSTU2 note: Note that values including meta, such as Patient.meta will work for DSTU2 parsers, but values with subelements on meta such as Patient.meta.lastUpdated will only work in DSTU3 mode.

stripVersionsFromReferences.label: advanced
stripVersionsFromReferences.description: If set to true (which is the default), resource references containing a version will have the version removed when the resource is encoded. This is generally good behaviour because in most situations, references from one resource to another should be to the resource by ID, not by ID and version. In some cases though, it may be desirable to preserve the version in resource links. In that case, this value should be set to false. This method provides the ability to globally disable reference encoding. If finer-grained control is needed, use setDontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths(List)

overrideResourceIdWithBundleEntryFullUrl.displayName: Override Resource Id With Bundle Entry Full Url
overrideResourceIdWithBundleEntryFullUrl.label: advanced
overrideResourceIdWithBundleEntryFullUrl.description: If set to true (which is the default), the Bundle.entry.fullUrl will override the Bundle.entry.resource's resource id if the fullUrl is defined. This behavior happens when parsing the source data into a Bundle object. Set this to false if this is not the desired behavior (e.g. the client code wishes to perform additional validation checks between the fullUrl and the resource id).

summaryMode.label: advanced
summaryMode.description: If set to true (default is false) only elements marked by the FHIR specification as being summary elements will be included.

suppressNarratives.label: advanced
suppressNarratives.description: If set to true (default is false), narratives will not be included in the encoded values.

dontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths.displayName: Dont Strip Versions From References At Paths
dontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths.label: advanced
dontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths.description: If supplied value(s), any resource references at the specified paths will have their resource versions encoded instead of being automatically stripped during the encoding process. This setting has no effect on the parsing process. Multiple elements can be separated by comma when using String parameter. This method provides a finer-grained level of control than setStripVersionsFromReferences(String) and any paths specified by this method will be encoded even if setStripVersionsFromReferences(String) has been set to true (which is the default)

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: fhirXml
dataformat.title: FHIR XML
dataformat.description: Marshall and unmarshall FHIR objects to/from XML.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,hl7,xml

fhirVersion.description: The version of FHIR to use. Possible values are: DSTU2,DSTU2_HL7ORG,DSTU2_1,DSTU3,R4,R5

fhirContext.label: advanced
fhirContext.description: To use a custom fhir context. Reference to object of type ca.uhn.fhir.context.FhirContext

prettyPrint.description: Sets the pretty print flag, meaning that the parser will encode resources with human-readable spacing and newlines between elements instead of condensing output as much as possible.

parserErrorHandler.label: advanced
parserErrorHandler.description: Registers an error handler which will be invoked when any parse errors are found. Reference to object of type ca.uhn.fhir.parser.IParserErrorHandler

parserOptions.label: advanced
parserOptions.description: Sets the parser options object which will be used to supply default options to newly created parsers. Reference to object of type ca.uhn.fhir.context.ParserOptions.

preferTypes.label: advanced
preferTypes.description: If set (FQN class names), when parsing resources the parser will try to use the given types when possible, in the order that they are provided (from highest to lowest priority). For example, if a custom type which declares to implement the Patient resource is passed in here, and the parser is parsing a Bundle containing a Patient resource, the parser will use the given custom type. Multiple class names can be separated by comma.

forceResourceId.label: advanced
forceResourceId.description: When encoding, force this resource ID to be encoded as the resource ID. Reference to object of type org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IIdType

serverBaseUrl.label: advanced
serverBaseUrl.description: Sets the server's base URL used by this parser. If a value is set, resource references will be turned into relative references if they are provided as absolute URLs but have a base matching the given base.

omitResourceId.label: advanced
omitResourceId.description: If set to true (default is false) the ID of any resources being encoded will not be included in the output. Note that this does not apply to contained resources, only to root resources. In other words, if this is set to true, contained resources will still have local IDs but the outer/containing ID will not have an ID.

encodeElementsAppliesToChildResourcesOnl.displayName: Encode Elements Applies To Child Resources Only
encodeElementsAppliesToChildResourcesOnl.label: advanced
encodeElementsAppliesToChildResourcesOnl.description: If set to true (default is false), the values supplied to setEncodeElements(Set) will not be applied to the root resource (typically a Bundle), but will be applied to any sub-resources contained within it (i.e. search result resources in that bundle)

encodeElements.label: advanced
encodeElements.description: If provided, specifies the elements which should be encoded, to the exclusion of all others. Multiple elements can be separated by comma when using String parameter. Valid values for this field would include: Patient - Encode patient and all its children Patient.name - Encode only the patient's name Patient.name.family - Encode only the patient's family name .text - Encode the text element on any resource (only the very first position may contain a wildcard) .(mandatory) - This is a special case which causes any mandatory fields (min 0) to be encoded

dontEncodeElements.label: advanced
dontEncodeElements.description: If provided, specifies the elements which should NOT be encoded. Multiple elements can be separated by comma when using String parameter. Valid values for this field would include: Patient - Don't encode patient and all its children Patient.name - Don't encode the patient's name Patient.name.family - Don't encode the patient's family name .text - Don't encode the text element on any resource (only the very first position may contain a wildcard) DSTU2 note: Note that values including meta, such as Patient.meta will work for DSTU2 parsers, but values with subelements on meta such as Patient.meta.lastUpdated will only work in DSTU3 mode.

stripVersionsFromReferences.label: advanced
stripVersionsFromReferences.description: If set to true (which is the default), resource references containing a version will have the version removed when the resource is encoded. This is generally good behaviour because in most situations, references from one resource to another should be to the resource by ID, not by ID and version. In some cases though, it may be desirable to preserve the version in resource links. In that case, this value should be set to false. This method provides the ability to globally disable reference encoding. If finer-grained control is needed, use setDontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths(List)

overrideResourceIdWithBundleEntryFullUrl.displayName: Override Resource Id With Bundle Entry Full Url
overrideResourceIdWithBundleEntryFullUrl.label: advanced
overrideResourceIdWithBundleEntryFullUrl.description: If set to true (which is the default), the Bundle.entry.fullUrl will override the Bundle.entry.resource's resource id if the fullUrl is defined. This behavior happens when parsing the source data into a Bundle object. Set this to false if this is not the desired behavior (e.g. the client code wishes to perform additional validation checks between the fullUrl and the resource id).

summaryMode.label: advanced
summaryMode.description: If set to true (default is false) only elements marked by the FHIR specification as being summary elements will be included.

suppressNarratives.label: advanced
suppressNarratives.description: If set to true (default is false), narratives will not be included in the encoded values.

dontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths.displayName: Dont Strip Versions From References At Paths
dontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths.label: advanced
dontStripVersionsFromReferencesAtPaths.description: If supplied value(s), any resource references at the specified paths will have their resource versions encoded instead of being automatically stripped during the encoding process. This setting has no effect on the parsing process. Multiple elements can be separated by comma when using String parameter. This method provides a finer-grained level of control than setStripVersionsFromReferences(String) and any paths specified by this method will be encoded even if setStripVersionsFromReferences(String) has been set to true (which is the default)

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: flatpack
dataformat.title: Flatpack
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal Java lists and maps to/from flat files (such as CSV, delimited, or fixed length formats) using Flatpack library.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

definition.description: The flatpack pzmap configuration file. Can be omitted in simpler situations, but its preferred to use the pzmap.

fixed.description: Delimited or fixed. Is by default false = delimited

delimiter.description: The delimiter char (could be ; , or similar)

ignoreFirstRecord.description: Whether the first line is ignored for delimited files (for the column headers). Is by default true.

allowShortLines.description: Allows for lines to be shorter than expected and ignores the extra characters

ignoreExtraColumns.description: Allows for lines to be longer than expected and ignores the extra characters.

textQualifier.label: advanced
textQualifier.description: If the text is qualified with a character. Uses quote character by default.

parserFactoryRef.label: advanced
parserFactoryRef.description: References to a custom parser factory to lookup in the registry

dataformat.name: grok
dataformat.title: Grok
dataformat.description: Unmarshal unstructured data to objects using Logstash based Grok patterns.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

pattern.description: The grok pattern to match lines of input

flattened.description: Turns on flattened mode. In flattened mode the exception is thrown when there are multiple pattern matches with same key.

allowMultipleMatchesPerLine.description: If false, every line of input is matched for pattern only once. Otherwise the line can be scanned multiple times when non-terminal pattern is used.

namedOnly.description: Whether to capture named expressions only or not (i.e. %{IP:ip} but not ${IP})

dataformat.name: gson
dataformat.title: JSON Gson
dataformat.description: Marshal POJOs to JSON and back using Gson
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,json

prettyPrint.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dateFormatPattern.description: To configure the date format while marshall or unmarshall Date fields in JSON using Gson

dataformat.name: gzipDeflater
dataformat.title: GZip Deflater
dataformat.description: Compress and decompress messages using java.util.zip.GZIPStream.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

dataformat.name: hl7
dataformat.title: HL7
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal HL7 (Health Care) model objects using the HL7 MLLP codec.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,hl7

validate.description: Whether to validate the HL7 message Is by default true.

dataformat.name: ical
dataformat.title: iCal
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal iCal (.ics) documents to/from model objects.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

dataformat.name: jackson
dataformat.title: JSON Jackson
dataformat.description: Marshal POJOs to JSON and back using Jackson.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,json

objectMapper.description: Lookup and use the existing ObjectMapper with the given id when using Jackson.

useDefaultObjectMapper.description: Whether to lookup and use default Jackson ObjectMapper from the registry.

autoDiscoverObjectMapper.description: If set to true then Jackson will look for an objectMapper to use from the registry

prettyPrint.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

jsonView.label: advanced
jsonView.description: When marshalling a POJO to JSON you might want to exclude certain fields from the JSON output. With Jackson you can use JSON views to accomplish this. This option is to refer to the class which has JsonView annotations

include.label: advanced
include.description: If you want to marshal a pojo to JSON, and the pojo has some fields with null values. And you want to skip these null values, you can set this option to NON_NULL

allowJmsType.label: advanced
allowJmsType.description: Used for JMS users to allow the JMSType header from the JMS spec to specify a FQN classname to use to unmarshal to.

collectionType.label: advanced
collectionType.description: Refers to a custom collection type to lookup in the registry to use. This option should rarely be used, but allows using different collection types than java.util.Collection based as default.

useList.description: To unmarshal to a List of Map or a List of Pojo.

moduleClassNames.label: advanced
moduleClassNames.description: To use custom Jackson modules com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.Module specified as a String with FQN class names. Multiple classes can be separated by comma.

moduleRefs.label: advanced
moduleRefs.description: To use custom Jackson modules referred from the Camel registry. Multiple modules can be separated by comma.

enableFeatures.label: advanced
enableFeatures.description: Set of features to enable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

disableFeatures.label: advanced
disableFeatures.description: Set of features to disable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

allowUnmarshallType.description: If enabled then Jackson is allowed to attempt to use the CamelJacksonUnmarshalType header during the unmarshalling. This should only be enabled when desired to be used.

timezone.label: advanced
timezone.description: If set then Jackson will use the Timezone when marshalling/unmarshalling. This option will have no effect on the others Json DataFormat, like gson and fastjson.

schemaResolver.label: advanced
schemaResolver.description: Optional schema resolver used to lookup schemas for the data in transit.

autoDiscoverSchemaResolver.label: advanced
autoDiscoverSchemaResolver.description: When not disabled, the SchemaResolver will be looked up into the registry

namingStrategy.description: If set then Jackson will use the the defined Property Naming Strategy.Possible values are: LOWER_CAMEL_CASE, LOWER_DOT_CASE, LOWER_CASE, KEBAB_CASE, SNAKE_CASE and UPPER_CAMEL_CASE

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: jacksonXml
dataformat.title: Jackson XML
dataformat.description: Unmarshal an XML payloads to POJOs and back using XMLMapper extension of Jackson.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,xml

xmlMapper.label: advanced
xmlMapper.description: Lookup and use the existing XmlMapper with the given id.

prettyPrint.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

allowUnmarshallType.description: If enabled then Jackson is allowed to attempt to use the CamelJacksonUnmarshalType header during the unmarshalling. This should only be enabled when desired to be used.

jsonView.description: When marshalling a POJO to JSON you might want to exclude certain fields from the JSON output. With Jackson you can use JSON views to accomplish this. This option is to refer to the class which has JsonView annotations

include.description: If you want to marshal a pojo to JSON, and the pojo has some fields with null values. And you want to skip these null values, you can set this option to NON_NULL

allowJmsType.label: advanced
allowJmsType.description: Used for JMS users to allow the JMSType header from the JMS spec to specify a FQN classname to use to unmarshal to.

collectionType.label: advanced
collectionType.description: Refers to a custom collection type to lookup in the registry to use. This option should rarely be used, but allows to use different collection types than java.util.Collection based as default.

useList.description: To unmarshal to a List of Map or a List of Pojo.

timezone.label: advanced
timezone.description: If set then Jackson will use the Timezone when marshalling/unmarshalling.

enableJaxbAnnotationModule.label: advanced
enableJaxbAnnotationModule.description: Whether to enable the JAXB annotations module when using jackson. When enabled then JAXB annotations can be used by Jackson.

moduleClassNames.label: advanced
moduleClassNames.description: To use custom Jackson modules com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.Module specified as a String with FQN class names. Multiple classes can be separated by comma.

moduleRefs.label: advanced
moduleRefs.description: To use custom Jackson modules referred from the Camel registry. Multiple modules can be separated by comma.

enableFeatures.description: Set of features to enable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

disableFeatures.description: Set of features to disable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: jaxb
dataformat.title: JAXB
dataformat.description: Unmarshal XML payloads to POJOs and back using JAXB2 XML marshalling standard.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,xml

contextPath.description: Package name where your JAXB classes are located.

contextPathIsClassName.description: This can be set to true to mark that the contextPath is referring to a classname and not a package name.

schema.description: To validate against an existing schema. Your can use the prefix classpath:, file: or http: to specify how the resource should be resolved. You can separate multiple schema files by using the ',' character.

schemaSeverityLevel.description: Sets the schema severity level to use when validating against a schema. This level determines the minimum severity error that triggers JAXB to stop continue parsing. The default value of 0 (warning) means that any error (warning, error or fatal error) will trigger JAXB to stop. There are the following three levels: 0=warning, 1=error, 2=fatal error.

prettyPrint.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

objectFactory.label: advanced
objectFactory.description: Whether to allow using ObjectFactory classes to create the POJO classes during marshalling. This only applies to POJO classes that has not been annotated with JAXB and providing jaxb.index descriptor files.

ignoreJAXBElement.label: advanced
ignoreJAXBElement.description: Whether to ignore JAXBElement elements - only needed to be set to false in very special use-cases.

mustBeJAXBElement.label: advanced
mustBeJAXBElement.description: Whether marhsalling must be java objects with JAXB annotations. And if not then it fails. This option can be set to false to relax that, such as when the data is already in XML format.

filterNonXmlChars.label: advanced
filterNonXmlChars.description: To ignore non xml characheters and replace them with an empty space.

encoding.description: To overrule and use a specific encoding

fragment.label: advanced
fragment.description: To turn on marshalling XML fragment trees. By default JAXB looks for XmlRootElement annotation on given class to operate on whole XML tree. This is useful but not always - sometimes generated code does not have XmlRootElement annotation, sometimes you need unmarshall only part of tree. In that case you can use partial unmarshalling. To enable this behaviours you need set property partClass. Camel will pass this class to JAXB's unmarshaler.

partClass.label: advanced
partClass.description: Name of class used for fragment parsing. See more details at the fragment option.

partNamespace.label: advanced
partNamespace.description: XML namespace to use for fragment parsing. See more details at the fragment option.

namespacePrefixRef.label: advanced
namespacePrefixRef.description: When marshalling using JAXB or SOAP then the JAXB implementation will automatic assign namespace prefixes, such as ns2, ns3, ns4 etc. To control this mapping, Camel allows you to refer to a map which contains the desired mapping.

xmlStreamWriterWrapper.label: advanced
xmlStreamWriterWrapper.description: To use a custom xml stream writer.

schemaLocation.description: To define the location of the schema

noNamespaceSchemaLocation.label: advanced
noNamespaceSchemaLocation.description: To define the location of the namespaceless schema

jaxbProviderProperties.label: advanced
jaxbProviderProperties.description: Refers to a custom java.util.Map to lookup in the registry containing custom JAXB provider properties to be used with the JAXB marshaller.

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

accessExternalSchemaProtocols.label: security
accessExternalSchemaProtocols.description: Only in use if schema validation has been enabled. Restrict access to the protocols specified for external reference set by the schemaLocation attribute, Import and Include element. Examples of protocols are file, http, jar:file. false or none to deny all access to external references; a specific protocol, such as file, to give permission to only the protocol; the keyword all to grant permission to all protocols.

dataformat.name: jsonApi
dataformat.title: JSonApi
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal JSON:API resources using JSONAPI-Converter library.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

dataFormatTypes.description: The classes to take into account for the marshalling. Multiple classes can be separated by comma.

mainFormatType.description: The class to take into account while unmarshalling.

dataformat.name: jsonb
dataformat.title: JSON JSON-B
dataformat.description: Marshal POJOs to JSON and back using JSON-B.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,json

objectMapper.description: Lookup and use the existing Jsonb instance with the given id.

prettyPrint.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

dataformat.name: lzf
dataformat.title: LZF Deflate Compression
dataformat.description: Compress and decompress streams using LZF deflate algorithm.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

usingParallelCompression.description: Enable encoding (compress) using multiple processing cores.

dataformat.name: mimeMultipart
dataformat.title: MIME Multipart
dataformat.description: Marshal Camel messages with attachments into MIME-Multipart messages and back.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

multipartSubType.description: Specify the subtype of the MIME Multipart. Default is mixed.

multipartWithoutAttachment.description: Defines whether a message without attachment is also marshaled into a MIME Multipart (with only one body part). Default is false.

headersInline.description: Defines whether the MIME-Multipart headers are part of the message body (true) or are set as Camel headers (false). Default is false.

includeHeaders.description: A regex that defines which Camel headers are also included as MIME headers into the MIME multipart. This will only work if headersInline is set to true. Default is to include no headers

binaryContent.description: Defines whether the content of binary parts in the MIME multipart is binary (true) or Base-64 encoded (false) Default is false.

dataformat.name: parquetAvro
dataformat.title: Parquet File
dataformat.description: Parquet Avro serialization and de-serialization.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,file

compressionCodecName.description: Compression codec to use when marshalling.

unmarshalType.description: Class to use when (un)marshalling. If omitted, parquet files are converted into Avro's GenericRecords for unmarshalling and input objects are assumed as GenericRecords for marshalling.

dataformat.name: pgp
dataformat.title: PGP
dataformat.description: Encrypt and decrypt messages using Java Cryptographic Extension (JCE) and PGP.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,security

keyUserid.description: The user ID of the key in the PGP keyring used during encryption. Can also be only a part of a user ID. For example, if the user ID is Test User then you can use the part Test User or to address the user ID.

signatureKeyUserid.description: User ID of the key in the PGP keyring used for signing (during encryption) or signature verification (during decryption). During the signature verification process the specified User ID restricts the public keys from the public keyring which can be used for the verification. If no User ID is specified for the signature verficiation then any public key in the public keyring can be used for the verification. Can also be only a part of a user ID. For example, if the user ID is Test User then you can use the part Test User or to address the User ID.

password.description: Password used when opening the private key (not used for encryption).

signaturePassword.description: Password used when opening the private key used for signing (during encryption).

keyFileName.description: Filename of the keyring; must be accessible as a classpath resource (but you can specify a location in the file system by using the file: prefix).

signatureKeyFileName.description: Filename of the keyring to use for signing (during encryption) or for signature verification (during decryption); must be accessible as a classpath resource (but you can specify a location in the file system by using the file: prefix).

signatureKeyRing.description: Keyring used for signing/verifying as byte array. You can not set the signatureKeyFileName and signatureKeyRing at the same time.

armored.description: This option will cause PGP to base64 encode the encrypted text, making it available for copy/paste, etc.

integrity.description: Adds an integrity check/sign into the encryption file. The default value is true.

provider.description: Java Cryptography Extension (JCE) provider, default is Bouncy Castle (BC). Alternatively you can use, for example, the IAIK JCE provider; in this case the provider must be registered beforehand and the Bouncy Castle provider must not be registered beforehand. The Sun JCE provider does not work.

algorithm.description: Symmetric key encryption algorithm; possible values are defined in org.bouncycastle.bcpg.SymmetricKeyAlgorithmTags; for example 2 (= TRIPLE DES), 3 (= CAST5), 4 (= BLOWFISH), 6 (= DES), 7 (= AES_128). Only relevant for encrypting.

compressionAlgorithm.description: Compression algorithm; possible values are defined in org.bouncycastle.bcpg.CompressionAlgorithmTags; for example 0 (= UNCOMPRESSED), 1 (= ZIP), 2 (= ZLIB), 3 (= BZIP2). Only relevant for encrypting.

hashAlgorithm.description: Signature hash algorithm; possible values are defined in org.bouncycastle.bcpg.HashAlgorithmTags; for example 2 (= SHA1), 8 (= SHA256), 9 (= SHA384), 10 (= SHA512), 11 (=SHA224). Only relevant for signing.

signatureVerificationOption.description: Controls the behavior for verifying the signature during unmarshaling. There are 4 values possible: optional: The PGP message may or may not contain signatures; if it does contain signatures, then a signature verification is executed. required: The PGP message must contain at least one signature; if this is not the case an exception (PGPException) is thrown. A signature verification is executed. ignore: Contained signatures in the PGP message are ignored; no signature verification is executed. no_signature_allowed: The PGP message must not contain a signature; otherwise an exception (PGPException) is thrown.

dataformat.name: protobuf
dataformat.title: Protobuf
dataformat.description: Serialize and deserialize Java objects using Google's Protocol buffers.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

instanceClass.description: Name of class to use when unmarshalling

contentTypeFormat.description: Defines a content type format in which protobuf message will be serialized/deserialized from(to) the Java been. The format can either be native or json for either native protobuf or json fields representation. The default value is native.

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: protobufJackson
dataformat.title: Protobuf Jackson
dataformat.description: Marshal POJOs to Protobuf and back using Jackson.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

objectMapper.label: advanced
objectMapper.description: Lookup and use the existing ObjectMapper with the given id when using Jackson.

useDefaultObjectMapper.description: Whether to lookup and use default Jackson ObjectMapper from the registry.

autoDiscoverObjectMapper.description: If set to true then Jackson will lookup for an objectMapper into the registry

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

jsonView.description: When marshalling a POJO to JSON you might want to exclude certain fields from the JSON output. With Jackson you can use JSON views to accomplish this. This option is to refer to the class which has JsonView annotations

include.description: If you want to marshal a pojo to JSON, and the pojo has some fields with null values. And you want to skip these null values, you can set this option to NON_NULL

allowJmsType.label: advanced
allowJmsType.description: Used for JMS users to allow the JMSType header from the JMS spec to specify a FQN classname to use to unmarshal to.

collectionType.description: Refers to a custom collection type to lookup in the registry to use. This option should rarely be used, but allows to use different collection types than java.util.Collection based as default.

useList.description: To unmarshal to a List of Map or a List of Pojo.

moduleClassNames.label: advanced
moduleClassNames.description: To use custom Jackson modules com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.Module specified as a String with FQN class names. Multiple classes can be separated by comma.

moduleRefs.label: advanced
moduleRefs.description: To use custom Jackson modules referred from the Camel registry. Multiple modules can be separated by comma.

enableFeatures.description: Set of features to enable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

disableFeatures.description: Set of features to disable on the Jackson com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper. The features should be a name that matches a enum from com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationFeature, or com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.MapperFeature Multiple features can be separated by comma

allowUnmarshallType.description: If enabled then Jackson is allowed to attempt to use the CamelJacksonUnmarshalType header during the unmarshalling. This should only be enabled when desired to be used.

timezone.label: advanced
timezone.description: If set then Jackson will use the Timezone when marshalling/unmarshalling.

schemaResolver.label: advanced
schemaResolver.description: Optional schema resolver used to lookup schemas for the data in transit.

autoDiscoverSchemaResolver.label: advanced
autoDiscoverSchemaResolver.description: When not disabled, the SchemaResolver will be looked up into the registry

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: rss
dataformat.title: RSS
dataformat.description: Transform from ROME SyndFeed Java Objects to XML and vice-versa.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

dataformat.name: snakeYaml
dataformat.title: YAML SnakeYAML
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal Java objects to and from YAML using SnakeYAML
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,yaml

library.description: Which yaml library to use. By default it is SnakeYAML

unmarshalType.description: Class name of the java type to use when unmarshalling

prettyFlow.description: Force the emitter to produce a pretty YAML document when using the flow style.

allowAnyType.description: Allow any class to be un-marshaled

typeFilter.description: Set the types SnakeYAML is allowed to un-marshall

maxAliasesForCollections.label: advanced
maxAliasesForCollections.description: Set the maximum amount of aliases allowed for collections.

allowRecursiveKeys.label: advanced
allowRecursiveKeys.description: Set whether recursive keys are allowed.

dataformat.name: soap
dataformat.title: SOAP
dataformat.description: Marshal Java objects to SOAP messages and back.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,xml

contextPath.description: Package name where your JAXB classes are located.

encoding.description: To overrule and use a specific encoding

elementNameStrategyRef.label: advanced
elementNameStrategyRef.description: Refers to an element strategy to lookup from the registry. An element name strategy is used for two purposes. The first is to find a xml element name for a given object and soap action when marshaling the object into a SOAP message. The second is to find an Exception class for a given soap fault name. The following three element strategy class name is provided out of the box. QNameStrategy - Uses a fixed qName that is configured on instantiation. Exception lookup is not supported TypeNameStrategy - Uses the name and namespace from the XMLType annotation of the given type. If no namespace is set then package-info is used. Exception lookup is not supported ServiceInterfaceStrategy - Uses information from a webservice interface to determine the type name and to find the exception class for a SOAP fault All three classes is located in the package name org.apache.camel.dataformat.soap.name If you have generated the web service stub code with cxf-codegen or a similar tool then you probably will want to use the ServiceInterfaceStrategy. In the case you have no annotated service interface you should use QNameStrategy or TypeNameStrategy.

version.description: SOAP version should either be 1.1 or 1.2. Is by default 1.1

namespacePrefixRef.label: advanced
namespacePrefixRef.description: When marshalling using JAXB or SOAP then the JAXB implementation will automatic assign namespace prefixes, such as ns2, ns3, ns4 etc. To control this mapping, Camel allows you to refer to a map which contains the desired mapping.

schema.description: To validate against an existing schema. Your can use the prefix classpath:, file: or http: to specify how the resource should be resolved. You can separate multiple schema files by using the ',' character.

dataformat.name: swiftMt
dataformat.title: SWIFT MT
dataformat.description: Encode and decode SWIFT MT messages.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,swift

writeInJson.label: advanced
writeInJson.description: The flag indicating that messages must be marshalled in a JSON format.

dataformat.name: swiftMx
dataformat.title: SWIFT MX
dataformat.description: Encode and decode SWIFT MX messages.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,swift

writeConfigRef.label: advanced
writeConfigRef.description: Refers to a specific configuration to use when marshalling a message to lookup from the registry.

writeInJson.label: advanced
writeInJson.description: The flag indicating that messages must be marshalled in a JSON format.

readMessageId.label: advanced
readMessageId.description: The type of MX message to produce when unmarshalling an input stream. If not set, it will be automatically detected from the namespace used.

readConfigRef.label: advanced
readConfigRef.description: Refers to a specific configuration to use when unmarshalling an input stream to lookup from the registry.

dataformat.name: syslog
dataformat.title: Syslog
dataformat.description: Marshall SyslogMessages to RFC3164 and RFC5424 messages and back.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,monitoring

dataformat.name: tarFile
dataformat.title: Tar File
dataformat.description: Archive files into tarballs or extract files from tarballs.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,file

usingIterator.description: If the tar file has more than one entry, the setting this option to true, allows working with the splitter EIP, to split the data using an iterator in a streaming mode.

allowEmptyDirectory.description: If the tar file has more than one entry, setting this option to true, allows to get the iterator even if the directory is empty

preservePathElements.description: If the file name contains path elements, setting this option to true, allows the path to be maintained in the tar file.

maxDecompressedSize.label: advanced
maxDecompressedSize.description: Set the maximum decompressed size of a tar file (in bytes). The default value if not specified corresponds to 1 gigabyte. An IOException will be thrown if the decompressed size exceeds this amount. Set to -1 to disable setting a maximum decompressed size.

dataformat.name: thrift
dataformat.title: Thrift
dataformat.description: Serialize and deserialize messages using Apache Thrift binary data format.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

instanceClass.description: Name of class to use when unmarshalling

contentTypeFormat.description: Defines a content type format in which thrift message will be serialized/deserialized from(to) the Java been. The format can either be native or json for either native binary thrift, json or simple json fields representation. The default value is binary.

contentTypeHeader.description: Whether the data format should set the Content-Type header with the type from the data format. For example application/xml for data formats marshalling to XML, or application/json for data formats marshalling to JSON

dataformat.name: univocityCsv
dataformat.title: uniVocity CSV
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal Java objects from and to CSV (Comma Separated Values) using UniVocity Parsers.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

quoteAllFields.description: Whether or not all values must be quoted when writing them.

nullValue.label: advanced
nullValue.description: The string representation of a null value. The default value is null

skipEmptyLines.description: Whether or not the empty lines must be ignored. The default value is true

ignoreTrailingWhitespaces.description: Whether or not the trailing white spaces must be ignored. The default value is true

ignoreLeadingWhitespaces.description: Whether or not the leading white spaces must be ignored. The default value is true

headersDisabled.description: Whether or not the headers are disabled. When defined, this option explicitly sets the headers as null which indicates that there is no header. The default value is false

headerExtractionEnabled.description: Whether or not the header must be read in the first line of the test document The default value is false

numberOfRecordsToRead.label: advanced
numberOfRecordsToRead.description: The maximum number of record to read.

emptyValue.label: advanced
emptyValue.description: The String representation of an empty value

lineSeparator.label: advanced
lineSeparator.description: The line separator of the files The default value is to use the JVM platform line separator

normalizedLineSeparator.label: advanced
normalizedLineSeparator.description: The normalized line separator of the files The default value is a new line character.

comment.label: advanced
comment.description: The comment symbol. The default value is #

lazyLoad.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce an iterator that reads the lines on the fly or if all the lines must be read at one. The default value is false

asMap.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce maps for the lines values instead of lists. It requires to have header (either defined or collected). The default value is false

dataformat.name: univocityFixed
dataformat.title: uniVocity Fixed Length
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal Java objects from and to fixed length records using UniVocity Parsers.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

padding.description: The padding character. The default value is a space

skipTrailingCharsUntilNewline.description: Whether or not the trailing characters until new line must be ignored. The default value is false

recordEndsOnNewline.description: Whether or not the record ends on new line. The default value is false

nullValue.label: advanced
nullValue.description: The string representation of a null value. The default value is null

skipEmptyLines.description: Whether or not the empty lines must be ignored. The default value is true

ignoreTrailingWhitespaces.description: Whether or not the trailing white spaces must be ignored. The default value is true

ignoreLeadingWhitespaces.description: Whether or not the leading white spaces must be ignored. The default value is true

headersDisabled.description: Whether or not the headers are disabled. When defined, this option explicitly sets the headers as null which indicates that there is no header. The default value is false

headerExtractionEnabled.description: Whether or not the header must be read in the first line of the test document The default value is false

numberOfRecordsToRead.label: advanced
numberOfRecordsToRead.description: The maximum number of record to read.

emptyValue.label: advanced
emptyValue.description: The String representation of an empty value

lineSeparator.label: advanced
lineSeparator.description: The line separator of the files The default value is to use the JVM platform line separator

normalizedLineSeparator.label: advanced
normalizedLineSeparator.description: The normalized line separator of the files The default value is a new line character.

comment.label: advanced
comment.description: The comment symbol. The default value is #

lazyLoad.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce an iterator that reads the lines on the fly or if all the lines must be read at one. The default value is false

asMap.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce maps for the lines values instead of lists. It requires to have header (either defined or collected). The default value is false

dataformat.name: univocityTsv
dataformat.title: uniVocity TSV
dataformat.description: Marshal and unmarshal Java objects from and to TSV (Tab-Separated Values) records using UniVocity Parsers.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,csv

nullValue.label: advanced
nullValue.description: The string representation of a null value. The default value is null

skipEmptyLines.description: Whether or not the empty lines must be ignored. The default value is true

ignoreTrailingWhitespaces.description: Whether or not the trailing white spaces must be ignored. The default value is true

ignoreLeadingWhitespaces.description: Whether or not the leading white spaces must be ignored. The default value is true

headersDisabled.description: Whether or not the headers are disabled. When defined, this option explicitly sets the headers as null which indicates that there is no header. The default value is false

headerExtractionEnabled.description: Whether or not the header must be read in the first line of the test document The default value is false

numberOfRecordsToRead.label: advanced
numberOfRecordsToRead.description: The maximum number of record to read.

emptyValue.label: advanced
emptyValue.description: The String representation of an empty value

lineSeparator.label: advanced
lineSeparator.description: The line separator of the files The default value is to use the JVM platform line separator

normalizedLineSeparator.label: advanced
normalizedLineSeparator.description: The normalized line separator of the files The default value is a new line character.

comment.label: advanced
comment.description: The comment symbol. The default value is #

lazyLoad.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce an iterator that reads the lines on the fly or if all the lines must be read at one. The default value is false

asMap.description: Whether the unmarshalling should produce maps for the lines values instead of lists. It requires to have header (either defined or collected). The default value is false

dataformat.name: xmlSecurity
dataformat.title: XML Security
dataformat.description: Encrypt and decrypt XML payloads using Apache Santuario.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,xml

xmlCipherAlgorithm.description: The cipher algorithm to be used for encryption/decryption of the XML message content. The available choices are: XMLCipher.TRIPLEDES XMLCipher.AES_128 XMLCipher.AES_128_GCM XMLCipher.AES_192 XMLCipher.AES_192_GCM XMLCipher.AES_256 XMLCipher.AES_256_GCM XMLCipher.SEED_128 XMLCipher.CAMELLIA_128 XMLCipher.CAMELLIA_192 XMLCipher.CAMELLIA_256 The default value is XMLCipher.AES_256_GCM

passPhrase.description: A String used as passPhrase to encrypt/decrypt content. The passPhrase has to be provided. The passPhrase needs to be put together in conjunction with the appropriate encryption algorithm. For example using TRIPLEDES the passPhase can be a Only another 24 Byte key

passPhraseByte.label: advanced
passPhraseByte.description: A byte used as passPhrase to encrypt/decrypt content. The passPhrase has to be provided. The passPhrase needs to be put together in conjunction with the appropriate encryption algorithm. For example using TRIPLEDES the passPhase can be a Only another 24 Byte key

secureTag.description: The XPath reference to the XML Element selected for encryption/decryption. If no tag is specified, the entire payload is encrypted/decrypted.

secureTagContents.description: A boolean value to specify whether the XML Element is to be encrypted or the contents of the XML Element. false = Element Level. true = Element Content Level.

keyCipherAlgorithm.description: The cipher algorithm to be used for encryption/decryption of the asymmetric key. The available choices are: XMLCipher.RSA_v1dot5 XMLCipher.RSA_OAEP XMLCipher.RSA_OAEP_11 The default value is XMLCipher.RSA_OAEP

recipientKeyAlias.description: The key alias to be used when retrieving the recipient's public or private key from a KeyStore when performing asymmetric key encryption or decryption.

keyOrTrustStoreParametersRef.displayName: Key Or Trust Store Parameters Ref
keyOrTrustStoreParametersRef.description: Refers to a KeyStore instance to lookup in the registry, which is used for configuration options for creating and loading a KeyStore instance that represents the sender's trustStore or recipient's keyStore.

keyPassword.description: The password to be used for retrieving the private key from the KeyStore. This key is used for asymmetric decryption.

digestAlgorithm.description: The digest algorithm to use with the RSA OAEP algorithm. The available choices are: XMLCipher.SHA1 XMLCipher.SHA256 XMLCipher.SHA512 The default value is XMLCipher.SHA1

mgfAlgorithm.description: The MGF Algorithm to use with the RSA OAEP algorithm. The available choices are: EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA1 EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA256 EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA512 The default value is EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA1

addKeyValueForEncryptedKey.displayName: Add Key Value For Encrypted Key
addKeyValueForEncryptedKey.description: Whether to add the public key used to encrypt the session key as a KeyValue in the EncryptedKey structure or not.

dataformat.name: zipDeflater
dataformat.title: Zip Deflater
dataformat.description: Compress and decompress streams using java.util.zip.Deflater and java.util.zip.Inflater.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation

compressionLevel.description: To specify a specific compression between 0-9. -1 is default compression, 0 is no compression, and 9 is the best compression.

dataformat.name: zipFile
dataformat.title: Zip File
dataformat.description: Compression and decompress streams using java.util.zip.ZipStream.
dataformat.label: dataformat,transformation,file

usingIterator.description: If the zip file has more than one entry, the setting this option to true, allows working with the splitter EIP, to split the data using an iterator in a streaming mode.

allowEmptyDirectory.description: If the zip file has more than one entry, setting this option to true, allows to get the iterator even if the directory is empty

preservePathElements.description: If the file name contains path elements, setting this option to true, allows the path to be maintained in the zip file.

maxDecompressedSize.label: advanced
maxDecompressedSize.description: Set the maximum decompressed size of a zip file (in bytes). The default value if not specified corresponds to 1 gigabyte. An IOException will be thrown if the decompressed size exceeds this amount. Set to -1 to disable setting a maximum decompressed size.
